generalized_mechanism: reduced campus access → more dependency on home conditions for learning
representative_mechanism: reduced campus access → more dependency on home conditions for learning
top_contexts: living in small town and remote study
anticipation of returning to in-person instruction
top_antecedents: transition to online mode and home distractions
top_mechanisms: reduced campus access → more dependency on home conditions for learning
loss of campus routine and increased distractions → decreased academic performance
expectation of restored campus engagement and improved learning → motivation for in-person return
positive remote learning experience → preference for home study → avoidance of early commutes
stable household → sufficient resources for academic devices → baseline online learning capability
adequate resources → effective learning strategies → moderate satisfaction despite preference for campus
reduced access and delayed feedback → lower grades and specific course failure relative to baseline

generalized_mechanism: timely one → on
representative_mechanism: timely one-on-one → improved understanding; delayed email → self-learning burden
top_mechanisms: timely one-on-one → improved understanding; delayed email → self-learning burden
immediate engagement → clearer understanding → positive learning outcome and higher grade
immediate explanation → clearer understanding → positive affect and grade improvement
immediate personalized explanation → rapid conceptual grasp → positive learning outcome
timely clarification → improved understanding → positive learning experience; delayed response → frustration → negative learning experience
timely clarification → immediate problem resolution → improved understanding → higher performance

generalized_mechanism: reduced sleep → fatigue
representative_mechanism: reduced sleep → fatigue → lower concentration
top_antecedents: lack of routine and late-night work or scrolling
top_mechanisms: reduced sleep → fatigue → lower concentration
reduced sleep → fatigue and worse attention
reduced daytime focus → reliance on late-night study → sleep disruption
reduced restorative sleep → increased anxiety and reduced cognitive function
consistent sleep routine → preserved rest and coping capacity despite other stresses

generalized_mechanism: progression in program → stable major focus
representative_mechanism: progression in program → stable major focus
top_contexts: completion of a two-year vocational diploma
top_antecedents: transition from second to third year
top_mechanisms: progression in program → stable major focus
standard course load → academic challenge → engagement with relevant material
program completion → transitional planning toward further study and reflection on prior learning conditions
task interruptions → fragmented attention and reduced deep work periods

generalized_mechanism: frequent interruptions → inability to maintain study flow
representative_mechanism: frequent interruptions → inability to maintain study flow → reduced concentration
top_antecedents: higher stakes and need to compensate for missed content
top_mechanisms: frequent interruptions → inability to maintain study flow → reduced concentration
lack of physical breaks → fatigue and physical discomfort → reduced learning efficiency
long hours + inefficiency → exhaustion and reduced effective learning
fragmented study schedule → reduced productive time → increased study hours during exams

generalized_mechanism: shared space → distraction
representative_mechanism: shared space → distraction + weaker signal → hindered focus
top_mechanisms: shared space → distraction + weaker signal → hindered focus
limited private space + background noise → reliance on headphones and fragmented attention
private space → controlled study environment → improved focus and academic routine

generalized_mechanism: added monitor → improved multitasking and learning
representative_mechanism: added monitor → improved multitasking and learning
top_mechanisms: added monitor → improved multitasking and learning
multitasking → reduced lecture comprehension → need for rewatching
lack of monitoring → increased autonomy → positive study environment

generalized_mechanism: quick TA reply → relief; unanswered chat
representative_mechanism: quick TA reply → relief; unanswered chat → frustration
top_contexts: large online classes with limited staff response
top_antecedents: late-night forum post and chat overload
high student-to-teacher ratio and asynchronous replies
top_mechanisms: quick TA reply → relief; unanswered chat → frustration
delayed clarification → guesswork on assignment → lost marks and frustration
late/insufficient help → missed deadline or poor solution → frustration

generalized_mechanism: program change → evolving academic identity and engagement
representative_mechanism: program change → evolving academic identity and engagement
top_mechanisms: program change → evolving academic identity and engagement
age milestone → self-perception shift → uncertainty about academic identity
return to campus resources and social opportunities → anticipated restoration of student identity and improved learning

generalized_mechanism: technical issues disrupt collaboration → lower effectiveness of online group study
representative_mechanism: technical issues disrupt collaboration → lower effectiveness of online group study
top_contexts: shift of group study from in-person to online
top_antecedents: combined tech issues, poor interaction modalities, and social isolation
top_mechanisms: technical issues disrupt collaboration → lower effectiveness of online group study
technical + pedagogical deficits → low satisfaction and diminished sense of academic community
combination of tech failures and impersonal support → low course satisfaction

generalized_mechanism: limited connectivity options → unreliable access to synchronous learning
representative_mechanism: limited connectivity options → unreliable access to synchronous learning
top_contexts: family home in a large town near countryside
top_antecedents: 50 Mbps plan with minimal household usage
distance from neighbors and low local density
top_mechanisms: limited connectivity options → unreliable access to synchronous learning
reliable connection → minimal disruption during academic activities → positive learning experience
rural isolation → limited local infrastructure (connectivity/nearby support) → barriers to synchronous participation

generalized_mechanism: dependence on timely synchronous engagement and meaningful forum activity → variable learning outcomes depending on access and interaction quality
representative_mechanism: dependence on timely synchronous engagement and meaningful forum activity → variable learning outcomes depending on access and interaction quality
top_contexts: hybrid course design combining synchronous and asynchronous elements
contrast between in-person seminar dynamics and online delivery
contrast between in-person and online learning modes
top_antecedents: course structure requiring both live engagement and forum participation
loss of conversational and proximity-based learning opportunities
top_mechanisms: dependence on timely synchronous engagement and meaningful forum activity → variable learning outcomes depending on access and interaction quality
absence of immediate dialogic exchange → reduced conceptual engagement and lower performance for discussion-based learning
absence of live dialogic engagement → passive learning and lowered performance for dialogic learners

generalized_mechanism: mid → size household & moderate finances
representative_mechanism: mid-size household & moderate finances → moderate study conditions
top_mechanisms: mid-size household & moderate finances → moderate study conditions
shared household duties and presence → occasional interruptions and practical responsibilities affecting study time

generalized_mechanism: increased workload or procrastination → longer hours or late
representative_mechanism: increased workload or procrastination → longer hours or late-night cramming
top_antecedents: daytime fragmentation and need to catch up
top_mechanisms: increased workload or procrastination → longer hours or late-night cramming

generalized_mechanism: parallel gaming/social → attention split

top_antecedents: easy access to games and feeds
top_mechanisms: parallel gaming/social → attention split → missed lecture content

generalized_mechanism: benefit of home attendance offset by weak support and coordination → moderate satisfaction
representative_mechanism: benefit of home attendance offset by weak support and coordination → moderate satisfaction
top_antecedents: flexibility vs poor interaction vs rushed assignments
lack of interactivity and technical issues
top_mechanisms: benefit of home attendance offset by weak support and coordination → moderate satisfaction

generalized_mechanism: scheduled lectures plus home noise → fragmented study sessions
representative_mechanism: scheduled lectures plus home noise → fragmented study sessions → lower effective study time
top_mechanisms: scheduled lectures plus home noise → fragmented study sessions → lower effective study time

generalized_mechanism: extended social media use → fragmented attention

top_mechanisms: extended social media use → fragmented attention → lower productivity

top_mechanisms: less exercise → reduced energy and mood → potential impact on study capacity

top_mechanisms: light gaming as occasional break → limited impact on study

top_mechanisms: inability to afford upgrades or extra data → constrained access and persistent technical issues
